elements.name: ifNeitherexistingFAQ
elements.title: In a previous step you identified that you had an existing order or written agreement about child support. If you need an order about child support, and there is no order or written agreement already in place, please return to the Background step and de-select child support under the 'Please select which family law matter issue your existing written agreement or court order is about' question

elements.name: ifExistingFAQ
elements.title: You will need to include a copy of your written agreement(s) or court order(s) when you file your documents. You will be reminded to include a copy at the end of the service.

elements.name: existingResponsibilityType
elements.title: Select the option that best describes your responsibility for child support in the existing order or agreement.

choices.text: I am required to make payments for support of a child
I am to be paid support for a child

elements.name: filedWithDirector
elements.title: Is your order or agreement filed with the Director of Maintenance Enforcement to help with collecting child support?

elements.name: ifExistingFAQ
elements.title: If your order or written agreement is filed with the Director of Maintenance Enforcement, you must serve a copy of the application on the director. The Director of Maintenance Enforcement can be served by mailing the documents to the postal address provided by the director. Contact the Family Maintenance Enforcement Program to find out how best to serve them.

elements.name: orderDate
elements.title: Please provide the date the court made the order.
elements.description: The date should be referenced in the preamble on the order. For example, “Before the Honourable Judge Jones on May 1, 2016”. The date on the court stamp doesn’t always match the date the order was made.

elements.name: agreementDate
elements.title: Please provide the date the written agreement was signed.

elements.name: ChangeOrderExplanationFAQ
elements.title:
Family dynamics change and children grow up. A child support order that was made in the past may not make sense anymore. The court can only change or cancel an order if:
  • there has been a change in circumstances since the original court order was made
  • evidence of a substantial nature that was not available during the previous hearing has become available
  • evidence of a lack of financial disclosure by a party was discovered after the last order was made

elements.name: ChangeAgreementExplanationFAQ
elements.title:
Family dynamics change and children grow up. An agreement about child support that was made in the past may not make sense anymore. The court can only set aside or replace an agreement if the court would make an order for child support that is different from the agreement on consideration of the matters set out in section 150 [determining child support] of the Family Law Act.

Section 150 of the Family Law Act says that a court must consider the Child Support Guidelines when making an order about child support but may consider an amount different from the Child Support Guidelines if satisfied that:
  • the agreement about child support establishes reasonable arrangements for support of the child despite the amount being different from the Child Support Guidelines amount, or
  • applying the Child Support Guidelines would be inequitable on consideration of:
    • an agreement or order respecting the financial duties of the parents or guardians or the division or transfer of property, other than an agreement about child support, benefits the child directly or indirectly, or
    • special provisions have otherwise been made for the benefit of the child

elements.name: changesSinceOrderList
elements.title: Explain to the court what has changed that makes the existing order no longer appropriate.
elements.description: Select each option that fits your situation and provide the additional detail as required.
choices: I believe the other party’s financial situation has changed
The `special and extraordinary expenses` have changed
The living arrangements for a child have changed
Information has become available that was not available when the order was made

elements.name: changesSinceOrder
elements.title: Please describe the changes:
elements.visibleIf: ({existingType} = 'ExistingOrder') and ({changesSinceOrderList} anyof ['The `special and extraordinary expenses` have changed', 'The living arrangements for a child have changed'])

elements.name: newInfoSinceOrder
elements.title: Please describe the new information:
elements.visibleIf: ({existingType} = 'ExistingOrder') and ({changesSinceOrderList} contains 'Information has become available that was not available when the order was made')

elements.name: otherChangesSinceOrder
elements.title: Please describe the changes or circumstances:

elements.name: changesSinceAgreement
elements.title: Explain to the court why you believe the agreement should be set aside or replaced.
elements.description: You do not need to use any special wording. The key is to be as clear as possible.

elements.name: orderDifferenceType
elements.title: Do you want the existing order changed or cancelled?
elements.description:
You can apply to change the existing order if you still need an order about child support, but you want something different. Or you can apply to cancel the existing order.
Select the option that fits your situation.

elements.name: agreementDifferenceType
elements.title: Do you want the existing written agreement set aside or replaced?
elements.description: You can apply to set aside (cancel) the existing agreement or to replace it with a child support order if you believe you need something different.
